H1.text: who has majority in the house and senate. Independent

H2.text: who has majority in the house and senate. Libertarian

H3.text: who has majority in the house and senate. Republican

A4.text: The House of Representatives is controlled by the Republican Party.

A5.text: The Senate is controlled by the Democratic Party.

A6.text: The Senate of the 119th Congress is composed in 2025 of 53 Republicans, 45 Democrats, and 2 independents; both the independents caucus with the Democrats.

A7.text: The majority leader of the Senate is a Republican.

A8.text: As of 2025, the GOP holds the presidency, and majorities in both the U.S. House of Representatives and U.S. Senate, giving them a federal government trifecta.

A9.text: The Republicans also held a slim majority in the House and retook control of the Senate, securing the party's first trifecta since 2017.
